comments:
After ending a debug session of a simple HelloWorld on Solaris,
the following error appears in the .metadata/.log file.
(Nothing otherwise appears to be wrong; I was looking for something else.)
On JDK 1.3.1, I get both messages below.
On JDK 1.4.1, I only get the second message.
The messages occurred even if the HelloWorld application did not actually
read from nor write to the console.


!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.core 4 120 Sep 04, 2003 17:01:26.731
!MESSAGE Error logged from Debug Core: 
!STACK 0
java.io.IOException: read error
        at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.pty.PTYInputStream.read0(Native Method)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.pty.PTYInputStream.read(PTYInputStream.java:49)
        at java.io.InputStream.read(InputStream.java:86)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.OutputStreamMonitor.read
(OutputStreamMonitor.java:132)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.OutputStreamMonitor.access$1
(OutputStreamMonitor.java:124)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.OutputStreamMonitor$1.run
(OutputStreamMonitor.java:177)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:479)
!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.core 4 120 Sep 04, 2003 17:01:26.776
!MESSAGE Error logged from Debug Core: 
!STACK 0
java.io.IOException: close error
        at org.eclipse.cdt.utils.pty.PTYOutputStream.close
(PTYOutputStream.java:62)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.InputStreamMonitor.write
(InputStreamMonitor.java:102)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.InputStreamMonitor$1.run
(InputStreamMonitor.java:75)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:479)
Alain, can you look at this.

They are actually harmeless.

It is because the PTYStream is close by the debugger
__and__ also close multiple times by the eclipse framework.
Unfortunately they log the exception.

I will look for a solution.

Thanks for the reminder

Should be fix in the head.

Thanks for the PR.

        at java.io.InputStream.read(InputStream.java:86)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.OutputStreamMonitor.read
(OutputStreamMonitor.java:132)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.OutputStreamMonitor.access$1
(OutputStreamMonitor.java:124)
        at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.OutputStreamMonitor$1.run

        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:479)


Test HelloWorld uses cout, cerr, but not cin.

> Reopening.  Still seeing the following in 1.2.0.44:

Brent are you sure about this ?
Check the time log entry, maybe it was not for the session.

Doe this still happen ?
Although harmless, I would like to resolve this asap.

No longer reproduces with CDT 1.2.1 (build 20040302),
